page.title: 06HILL FARMING.MOOR SHEEP.
page.content: Mr Todd, who lives at William Beck Farm, is one of the sheep farmers in Bilsdale, he owns roughly 630 sheep some of which live up on the moor.Mr Todd owns 50 acres of moorland and is allowed to graze up to 200 sheep there.On average the lower sheep have 1.75 lambs per ewe and the moorland sheep.75 lamds per ewe and in the end roughly 300 lambs a year.MrTodd goes to the cattle market at stokesley about once a fortnight.The ewes usually live up to six years, the rams may get to live abit longer it depends on how good he is at producing baby lambs .The average weight of a fleece from sheep that's on the moors three lbs and a lower land 6 lbs The most common disease on the moors is tick and on the lowland foot rot. Mr Todd keeps two sheep dogs to help him.
